Title: Engineering Analyst, Messages Spam and Abuse
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Kirkland, WA, USA; Austin, TX, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in data analysis, including identifying trends, generating summary statistics, and drawing insights from quantitative and qualitative data.
2 years of experience managing projects and defining project scope, goals, and deliverables.
Experience with data analysis and database management (e.g., SQL, Python, etc.).


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree.
4 years of experience working on signal development, data analysis, cyber security, or anti-abuse.
Experience with fraud/abuse investigations, fraud risk management, security and threat analysis in the context of internet, telephony, or communication-related products.
Experience with one or more languages: SQL, Python, Golang, including knowledge in Messaging (xMS/RCS) or SIM/Phone Number fraud and abuse.
Excellent communication and presentation skills (e.g., written and verbal) to deliver findings to cross-functional partners, and the ability to influence cross-functionally at various levels.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with attention to detail in an ever-changing environment.


About the jobIn this role, you will work globally and cross-functionally with Google Engineers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and work on abuse and fraud.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $126,000-$181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Analyze emerging trends, conduct data analysis, and identify new signals to develop solutions for scaled enforcement.
Develop an understanding of abuse in messaging, current cross-product workflows, and available intelligence.
Work with cross-functional teams to design and build anti-abuse protections leveraging reputation at all levels (e.g., phone number, user, IP etc.), and advise on counter-abuse strategies, including productionizing Machine Learning (ML) models and heuristic rules.
Build, monitor and alert dashboards to track abuse levels, perform quality checks to measure system/model reliability, and resolve false positives. Create real-time awareness of threats and educate clients to reduce the problem upstream.
Lead projects to prevent Google's infrastructure from being abuse, harm, or fraud, resulting in losses to users or Google. Collaborate cross-functionally to develop requirements based on robust data analysis and granular product understanding.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Hiring || PeopleTech Group || Fulltime - W2 + Benefits || Rule Analyst / Data Quality SME || Redmond, WA (Onsite)




Role: Rule Analyst / Data Quality SME

Duration: Fulltime – People Tech Group - W2 + Benefits

Location: Redmond, WA (Onsite)

Job Description

We’re seeking a Rule Analyst / Data Quality SME to help HP ensure its data is clean, reliable, and ready for business use. You’ll be responsible for designing audit rules, analyzing data patterns, and documenting rule logic. This role bridges the gap between technical teams and business users by translating domain knowledge into automated quality checks.

Key Responsibilities:

Profile and analyze data to detect anomalies and trends.
Design and implement fixed and dynamic data quality rules.
Use SQL and HiveQL to validate rule outputs.
Document rule metadata including logic, thresholds, and ownership.
Map business logic into technical specifications.
Manage rule versions using YAML/JSON best practices.

Key Skills:




SQL, HiveQL, data profiling, rule-based validation, YAML/JSON, metadata management, business logic mapping.
Show more
HTML:
Hiring || PeopleTech Group || Fulltime - W2 + Benefits || Rule Analyst / Data Quality SME || Redmond, WA (Onsite)


Role: Rule Analyst / Data Quality SME

Duration: Fulltime – People Tech Group - W2 + Benefits

Location: Redmond, WA (Onsite)

Job Description

We’re seeking a Rule Analyst / Data Quality SME to help HP ensure its data is clean, reliable, and ready for business use. You’ll be responsible for designing audit rules, analyzing data patterns, and documenting rule logic. This role bridges the gap between technical teams and business users by translating domain knowledge into automated quality checks.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Profile and analyze data to detect anomalies and trends.
  • Design and implement fixed and dynamic data quality rules.
  • Use SQL and HiveQL to validate rule outputs.
  • Document rule metadata including logic, thresholds, and ownership.
  • Map business logic into technical specifications.
  • Manage rule versions using YAML/JSON best practices.

Key Skills:


  • SQL, HiveQL, data profiling, rule-based validation, YAML/JSON, metadata management, business logic mapping.

Title: Business Analyst, AADA Talent Acquisition Data Analytics (TADA)
Description:
Description

As a Business Analyst, this is your opportunity to be at the intersection of data, analysis, hiring, and strategy that will make it possible for our teams to fulfill that customer promise every day.

In this role, you will own data analytics projects from beginning to end, and will build reports, compile metrics, and own ad hoc and trend analysis. You will utilize business intelligence tools to analyze data and drive key recommendations. You will work with Talent Acquisition leadership to achieve business objectives and communicate insights to key stakeholders. You will recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation; and drive results in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.

You will provide analytical support for various Talent Acquisition programs, and build tools to surface timely, meaningful, and actionable data that will drive proactive decision making. Your analysis will contribute deeply to the development of our strategy and drive impact against our hiring objectives. You will collaborate with subject matter experts within AWS and across Amazon to work through complex problems and to create unified scalable reporting solutions at an enterprise-wide level. You will have the opportunity to partner with the central HR Information Systems teams as an influencer on their next generation road map.

Key job responsibilities


Building the design of operational dashboards and reports for both recruiting leaders and the businesses they support
Creating and maintaining data visualizations that inform stakeholders on key metrics
Conducting trend analysis to identify opportunities, highlight strengths, and provide recommended corrective actions
Providing recommendations on organization health metrics based on data trends
Developing programs, methodologies, and reports for analyzing and presenting data
Acting as a SME for corporate recruiting tools, and providing necessary training to team members on the usage of these tools
Performing regular system audits to ensure complete and accurate reporting of data/metrics
Performing complex data analysis across multiple systems to support both scheduled and ad-hoc reporting requests
Data mining key performance indicators to discover root causes
Working with a broad range of Amazon’s data resources in order to determine which sources to use for which information
Analyze business outcome data in order to identify relationships and trends; incorporate data visualization of statistical analyses
Contributing to the writing of research papers for internal audiences
Monitoring existing metrics, developing new metrics, and identifying actionable risk signals


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or equivalent
3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


- Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $66,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2987621

Title: Business/ Data Analyst, Selling Partner Support Impact Measurement
Description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon's Selling Partner Support Impact Measurement team is seeking an experienced Business Analyst (BA) who will be a key contributor developing robust measurement mechanisms and insights for products that directly impact sellers' experiences on Amazon. If you are a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, with a scientific mindset, then you are the right candidate for our team.

Join us in the Central Impact Measurement team of Amazon's Selling Partner (SP) Support Org and become part of a global team that is redefining the future of e-commerce. With access to vast amounts of data, scientific expertise, and a diverse community of talented individuals, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the way sellers engage with our platform and customers worldwide. Together, we will drive innovation, solve complex problems, and shape the future of e-commerce.

In this role, you will join the Selling Partner Support Partner Engagement org. You will help in developing and implementing causal inference mechanisms, data frameworks, and interactive dashboards and visualizations to drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will support the Global Process management team, the Root Cause Owning teams and One Amazon Support teams. measuring initiatives implemented for various metrics, and be instrumental in reporting on these initiatives.

About The Team

Impact Measurement team within SP Support Partner Engagement space is responsible for measuring the causal impact of programs aimed at improving SP experiences, with a primary focus on contact elimination, Average Case Handle Time (ACHT), case reopen rates, and other critical operational metrics. We implement advanced causal inference methodologies, particularly synthetic control methods, to enable data-driven decision making in contexts where traditional A/B experimentation is not feasible. Our team serves as the scientific backbone for evaluating program effectiveness across the organization, ensuring that business decisions are founded on rigorous, statistically valid evidence rather than correlational observations. Our customers include SP-Support Program and Product owners, Vendor support, One Amazon Support as well as 50+ upstream root cause owning teams.

Key job responsibilities


Use and contribute to causal inference methods to measure impact.
Contribute to scalable, robust code-base for measurements.
Create effective visualizations and dashboards that tell a compelling story and provide recommendations for new business initiatives.
Conduct driver analysis and develop time series models to forecast trends in metrics..
Provide training and support to business users, ensuring effective adoption and utilization of BI solutions.
Communicate data clearly and concisely, adjusting your style for different audiences to address complex financial issues effectively. Your communication will influence critical business decisions.


About The Team

Impact Measurement team within SP Support Partner Engagement space is responsible for measuring the causal impact of programs aimed at improving SP experiences, with a primary focus on contact elimination, Average Case Handle Time (ACHT), case reopen rates, and other critical operational metrics. We implement advanced causal inference methodologies, particularly synthetic control methods, to enable data-driven decision making in contexts where traditional A/B experimentation is not feasible. Our team serves as the scientific backbone for evaluating program effectiveness across the organization, ensuring that business decisions are founded on rigorous, statistically valid evidence rather than correlational observations. Our customers include SP-Support Program and Product owners, Vendor support, One Amazon Support as well as 50+ upstream root cause owning teams.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS


3+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Experience with Experiment design and observational Causal inference models
Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2990446

Title: Data Engineer, Product Analytics
Description:
As a Data Engineer at Meta, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Reality Labs, Threads). Your technical skills and analytical mindset will be utilized designing and building some of the world's most extensive data sets, helping to craft experiences for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses worldwide.In this role, you will collaborate with software engineering, data science, and product management teams to design/build scalable data solutions across Meta to optimize growth, strategy, and user experience for our 3 billion plus users, as well as our internal employee community.You will be at the forefront of identifying and solving some of the most interesting data challenges at a scale few companies can match. By joining Meta, you will become part of a world-class data engineering community dedicated to skill development and career growth in data engineering and beyond.Data Engineering: You will guide teams by building optimal data artifacts (including datasets and visualizations) to address key questions. You will refine our systems, design logging solutions, and create scalable data models. Ensuring data security and quality, and with a strong focus on efficiency, you will suggest architecture and development approaches and data management standards to address complex analytical problems.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, identify new opportunities, and tackle upcoming challenges. You'll ensure our products add value for users and businesses, by prioritizing projects, and driving innovative solutions to respond to challenges or opportunities.Communication and influence: You won't simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Engineer, Product Analytics Responsibilities:


Manage and execute data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products to solve well-scoped problems
Identify the data needed for a business problem and implement logging required to ensure availability of data, while working with data infrastructure to triage issues and resolve
Collaborate with engineers, product managers and data scientists to understand data needs, representing key data insights in a meaningful way
Build data expertise and leverage data controls to ensure privacy, security, compliance, data quality, and operations for allocated areas of ownership
Design, build and launch new data models and visualizations in production, leveraging common development toolkits
Independently design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production, mentoring others around efficient queries
Support existing processes running in production and implement optimized solutions with limited guidance
Define and manage Service Level Agreements for data sets in allocated areas of ownership


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent
2+ years of experience where the primary responsibility involves working with data. This could include roles such as data analyst, data scientist, data engineer, or similar positions
2+ years of experience with SQL, ETL, data modeling, and at least one programming language (e.g., Python, C++, C#, Scala or others.)


Preferred Qualifications:


Master's or Ph.D degree in a STEM field


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$114,000/year to $171,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Program Analyst
Description:
At TransWest, we design, implement, and manage world-class transportation systems for some of the most recognizable organizations globally. With a relentless focus on reliability, safety, and exceptional client service, we are redefining the way people commute while supporting our clients' sustainability and operational goals.

As a Program Analyst at TransWest, your mission is to transform data into decisions. You'll be the storyteller behind the strategy—providing the insights that power everything from daily operations to quarterly planning. If you're driven to deliver clarity, inspire confidence, and solve complex problems through data, this is your chance to shape the future of how we move.

Compensation:


$77,000 - $110,000 / year
Annual Discretionary Bonus Program



Benefits:


Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance
401k with matching
Annual pay raises
Holiday pay
Paid Time Off



Responsibilities:

Analytical Leadership


Gather, validate, and analyze data sets coming from a range of source across commute, campus, and on-demand programs
Identify trends, develop forecasts, and offer strategic recommendations to improve service and efficiency.
Monitor performance metrics and SLA's including ridership, OTP, GPS, fleet maintenance intervals, parking occupancy, and incident reports.



Program Reporting & Storytelling


Develop dashboards and scorecards in Power BI for internal teams and external client use.
Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports to inform MBRs, QBRs, and client presentations.
Create compelling data visualizations and presentations to communicate key findings and outcomes.



Operational Collaboration


Partner with Dispatch and Operations to monitor and validate incidents and service reliability.
Deliver actionable insights to Program Managers to support client communications and decisions.
Field incoming questions and issues across chat, email, phone, and tech platforms, supporting real-time decision-making.



Optimization & Insight Delivery


Proactively identify opportunities to enhance service performance and client value.
Recommend operational changes to Program Team based on historical data, current metrics, and predictive modeling.
Support new business planning efforts by contributing data-informed logistics strategies.



Culture & Core Values


Model TransWest's culture of safety, inclusion, and data-informed decision making.
Be a strong communicator and collaborator across all levels of the organization.
Embrace our entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment while balancing rigor and creativity.
Other duties as needed by our team.



Requirements:


2+ years of experience building and using PowerBI dashboarding and data visualization.
Proven ability to identify trends, develop strategies and implement solutions to drive results.
Experience in Transportation design, TDM, operations, or related work
Knowledge of Transportation technology and systems or ability to learn quickly
Experience in Program, Project Management, and/or Operational leadership roles
Strong independent worker and team player.
Experience in creating, organizing, and presenting data and findings is required.
Must be proficient with Microsoft 365 Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, Outlook)



TransWest Culture: Come join our close-knit team. We enjoy having summer BBQ's, holiday parties, games, contests and so much more at our bus yards and in the office.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging: At TransWest, we pride ourselves on building a diverse workforce and collaborative spaces where people of different lived experiences, backgrounds, abilities, and identities can thrive. Everyone on the team at TransWest emphasizes and practices our core values every day that are based on continued growth, reliability, safety, caring for our work, clients, and each other. Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion is an evolving area where we will continue to listen and learn from our team members, business partners, community partners, and thought leaders to optimize our impact.

  • Annual Discretionary Bonus Program


Benefits:

  • Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance
  • 401k with matching
  • Annual pay raises
  • Holiday pay
  • Paid Time Off


Responsibilities:

Analytical Leadership

  • Gather, validate, and analyze data sets coming from a range of source across commute, campus, and on-demand programs
  • Identify trends, develop forecasts, and offer strategic recommendations to improve service and efficiency.
  • Monitor performance metrics and SLA's including ridership, OTP, GPS, fleet maintenance intervals, parking occupancy, and incident reports.


Program Reporting & Storytelling

  • Develop dashboards and scorecards in Power BI for internal teams and external client use.
  • Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports to inform MBRs, QBRs, and client presentations.
  • Create compelling data visualizations and presentations to communicate key findings and outcomes.


Operational Collaboration

  • Partner with Dispatch and Operations to monitor and validate incidents and service reliability.
  • Deliver actionable insights to Program Managers to support client communications and decisions.
  • Field incoming questions and issues across chat, email, phone, and tech platforms, supporting real-time decision-making.


Optimization & Insight Delivery

  • Proactively identify opportunities to enhance service performance and client value.
  • Recommend operational changes to Program Team based on historical data, current metrics, and predictive modeling.
  • Support new business planning efforts by contributing data-informed logistics strategies.


Culture & Core Values

  • Model TransWest's culture of safety, inclusion, and data-informed decision making.
  • Be a strong communicator and collaborator across all levels of the organization.
  • Embrace our entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment while balancing rigor and creativity.
  • Other duties as needed by our team.


Requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience building and using PowerBI dashboarding and data visualization.
  • Proven ability to identify trends, develop strategies and implement solutions to drive results.
  • Experience in Transportation design, TDM, operations, or related work
  • Knowledge of Transportation technology and systems or ability to learn quickly
  • Experience in Program, Project Management, and/or Operational leadership roles
  • Strong independent worker and team player.
  • Experience in creating, organizing, and presenting data and findings is required.
  • Must be proficient with Microsoft 365 Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, Outlook)


TransWest Culture: Come join our close-knit team. We enjoy having summer BBQ's, holiday parties, games, contests and so much more at our bus yards and in the office.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging: At TransWest, we pride ourselves on building a diverse workforce and collaborative spaces where people of different lived experiences, backgrounds, abilities, and identities can thrive. Everyone on the team at TransWest emphasizes and practices our core values every day that are based on continued growth, reliability, safety, caring for our work, clients, and each other. Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion is an evolving area where we will continue to listen and learn from our team members, business partners, community partners, and thought leaders to optimize our impact.

Title: Analyst/Associate, Client Platform Analytics & Reporting - Atlanta/Seattle
Description:
About This Role

BlackRock Private Markets

BlackRock's global private markets business includes the firm's investment capabilities across Private Equity, Real Estate, Infrastructure, Private Credit, and Multi-Alternatives. BlackRock Private Markets currently manages over $300 billion in total assets and client commitments, with a team of over 900 professionals across BlackRock’s global teams, including 50+ offices with private markets capabilities, to deliver consistent returns over the long term.

Team Overview

Alternatives Client Platform (“ACP”) is a team with over 60 employees across several offices who support the coordination and administration of investor communications and collateral, programmed to ensure a best-in-class client experience for BlackRock’s Private Markets investors. This team is responsible for a wide range of activities, including the production of client and fund reports; marketing collateral and presentations; maintaining platform data and analytics; and with the roll out and adoption of new technologies to support the evolution of our scalable operating platform. By developing and sharing standard processes across our team, division, and firm, ACP drives scale and innovation while enhancing productivity in BlackRock Private Markets.

Job Description

We are seeking a high-energy, self-motivated individual to join our team. This individual must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple deliverables / tasks concurrently, and have a sense of urgency and emotional ownership that showcases a passion for quality and timeliness in our service delivery mandate. The role represents an opportunity to join the world’s largest asset manager and learn private markets and related asset classes while growing your career in a high performing, meritocratic, and culturally inclusive environment.

Key Responsibilities

Client Reporting / Investor Support


Coordinate the production of formal quarterly reporting packages by using portfolio-level and market updates from portfolio managers, asset managers, and fund administration teams across a variety of BlackRock Private Markets businesses.
Collect, validate, and aggregate qualitative and quantitative data attributes to service client reporting needs. Perform analysis on performance attribution, exposures, AUM, and flows data as necessary to meet the needs of the deliverable.
Manage, track, delegate, and collaborate with BLK colleagues on reoccurring data submissions, inclusive of custom client requests and regulatory reporting requirements.
Coordinate and prepare quarterly fund webcast materials in partnership with key partners.
Marketing Collateral / Fundraising Support
Lead marketing content refreshes, compliance approval submissions, and publications to prospective client data rooms.
Perform regular updates and maintenance of standard response for proposal (RFP) question and answer pairs in our Responsive software instance.
Actively participate in RFP responses through data gathering, analysis, and in other supportive capacities in conjunction with key internal partners.
Coordinate and complete customized client due-diligence requests, industry surveys, and consultant questionnaires.
Perform quarterly updates to strategy performance and track record information.
Support team members across the firm, including Investor Relations professionals, with ad hoc client meeting materials preparation, as well as general ad hoc information requests.


Operations Support and Enhancement Efforts


Support and investigate technology and process options to scale and automate routine client service activities.
Drive projects to enhance productivity and efficiency through technology and process re-engineering.
Maintain effective file storage management practices to ensure that cross-team partners can access relevant information managed by ACP.


Key Strengths and Qualities

The ideal candidate will demonstrate and showcase, through experience and accomplishments, the following strengths and qualities:


A sense of urgency, emotional ownership, and proactive execution of the deliverables assigned.
Operate in a fast-paced environment and under pressure in an organized manner, being able to prioritize, triage, and delegate tasks when vital to meet collaborator needs.
Professional presence and situational awareness to effectively communicate with key firm partners and in client related matters.
The ability to thrive in a team oriented, inclusive culture of excellence, innovation, communication, and accountability, where all members of the team are motivated to go above and beyond, think globally, and positively contribute to the ongoing evolution of the firm.
Experience challenging the status quo and seek better processes and outcomes.
Act autonomously and demonstrate self-initiative to get standing deliverables and project related work completed accurately and timely without continual oversight.
A desire and passion to learn the investment management industry, private markets asset classes, and the BlackRock firm and culture.


Key Qualifications


BA/BS required.
Fluency in written and spoken English is essential.
Persuasive and polished written and oral communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
A meticulous attention to detail.
Advanced proficiency in MS Office applications, particularly Word, PowerPoint and Excel, and ability to develop familiarity and skills using proprietary technology.
Strong data management and manipulation skills; experience with VBA or Python a plus.
Analytical ability to synthesize information and summarize issues.
0-3 years of experience for analyst level consideration; 3+ years of experience in financial services / asset management for associate level consideration.


#EarlyCareers For Seattle, WA and Atlanta, GA Only the salary range for this position is USD$71,250.00 - USD$90,000.00 . Additionally, employees are eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, and benefits including heath care, leave benefits, and retirement benefits. BlackRock operates a pay-for-performance compensation philosophy and your total compensation may vary based on role, location, and firm, department and individual performance.

Our Benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

Our hybrid work model

BlackRock’s hybrid work model is designed to enable a culture of collaboration and apprenticeship that enriches the experience of our employees, while supporting flexibility for all. Employees are currently required to work at least 4 days in the office per week, with the flexibility to work from home 1 day a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. We remain focused on increasing the impactful moments that arise when we work together in person – aligned with our commitment to performance and innovation. As a new joiner, you can count on this hybrid model to accelerate your learning and onboarding experience here at BlackRock.

About BlackRock

At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.

This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.

For additional information on BlackRock, please visit @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock

BlackRock is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity to all applicants and existing employees, and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity/expression), sexual orientation, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, marital status, political affiliation, religion, citizenship status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. View the EEOC’s Know Your Rights poster and its supplement and the pay transparency statement.

BlackRock is committed to full inclusion of all qualified individuals and to providing reasonable accommodations or job modifications for individuals with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation/adjustments are needed throughout the employment process, please email Disability.Assistance@blackrock.com. All requests are treated in line with our privacy policy.

BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Payment Acceptance, Amazon
Description:
Description

The Amazon Payments Acceptance & Experience Team is responsible for how Amazon’s customers pay on Amazon’s sites and through Amazon’s services around the globe. You will work with the biggest players in the payments industry to deliver best-in-class customer payment experiences while driving change in the industry.

As a Business Analyst, you're supporting the team to identify opportunities to improve paying experience. You analyze payments data, customers' preferences and payments partners data to drive decisions. You also build reports and mechanisms that help the team scale at the regional level through self-service tools. Finally, you engage with other analytics team to define models that contribute to refining business decisions.

Working in a dynamic environment, you will be responsible for automating dashboards, monitoring key success metrics, managing monthly/quarterly business reports, identifying problem areas and business challenges and collaboratively shaping solutions with Amazon Payments teams to help optimize on the platform. The successful candidate has a passion for extracting actionable insights from data. The candidate needs to innovate, and quickly become a subject matter expert to assess business performance across different Amazon Payments areas. The candidate should have significant experience working with automation, analyzing data, identifying trends, extracting conclusions, and presenting findings in a simple and clear manner using data across various data marts, and align focus on Amazon’s strategic needs.

Day To Day, You Will


Gather data and perform ad-hoc analytical exercises to generate actionable insights and improve customer payment experience.
Employ data mining, segmentation, and other analytical techniques to capture important trends and create relevant measurement dashboards (from internal data or external data).
Proactively work directly with business team to conduct deep dives and drive resolution.
Drive standardization, build tools and dashboards that the team can access self-service.
Develop models to forecast adoption, growth or profitability of some projects.
Suggest test methodologies to confirm hypothesis before investment decisions.


Key job responsibilities

Develop deep understanding of Payments domain drivers and impacts

Design and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in partnership with business teams

Convert complex data analysis into actionable business insights

Create automated reporting systems for weekly business metrics

Conduct advanced analytics including: Root cause analysis; Correlation studies; Regression modeling;

Process optimization

Build and maintain internal datasets to support rapid business analysis

Lead development of regular and ad-hoc reporting to drive business decisions

Aggregate multi-source data into clear, actionable formats

Define data elements for analytics and reporting capabilities

Identify business opportunities through pattern recognition and data analysis

Contribute to strategic planning and tactical execution

A day in the life

Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: 1. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage 2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options 3. Paid Time Off (PTO) 4. 401(k) Plan.

If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!

Basic Qualifications


3+ years of business analyst, data analyst or similar role experience
3+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
3+ years experience with Advanced with SQL


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in payments and/or ecommerce
Expert-level SQL proficiency including advanced query optimization, complex database operations (joins, subqueries, window functions), performance tuning, and extensive experience with various database management systems
Basic Data Pipeline understanding such as: end-to-end data pipeline development, ETL process management, data quality control, and system optimization, complemented by strong troubleshooting skills and multi-source data integration experience


Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $66,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2919396

Title: Data Quality Analyst I
Description:
At F5, we strive to bring a better digital world to life. Our teams empower organizations across the globe to create, secure, and run applications that enhance how we experience our evolving digital world. We are passionate about cybersecurity, from protecting consumers from fraud to enabling companies to focus on innovation. Everything we do centers around people. That means we obsess over how to make the lives of our customers, and their customers, better. And it means we prioritize a diverse F5 community where each individual can thrive. For over 20 years, F5 has been the industry leader in application delivery. Now, we’re helping our customers improve the performance and security of their applications, whether in the cloud or at the edge. F5 is the only company on the planet that powers applications from development through their entire lifecycle, enabling our customers—enterprise businesses, service providers, governments, and consumer brands—to deliver differentiated, high-performing, and secure digital experiences to their customers. Accurate and reliable data is a critical enabler in achieving this goal. We are seeking an experienced Data Steward II to join our Enterprise Data Management team, working closely with business partners across the company globally. You will support data quality initiatives, with a primary focus on quality analysis, managing customer hierarchies, and executing data change requests and performing necessary data entry in our core domains. Secondary responsibilities include proactively contributing enterprise data quality reporting, monitoring, and project efforts. This role directly supports globally distributed, cross-functional business stakeholders in Core Data and Data Quality management activities. Our Data Quality team also collaborates closely with the broader EDM team to support Data Governance and Metadata efforts. This role will also collaborate closely with other Enterprise Data Management resources to socialize and drive adoption of these efforts. The ideal candidate for this role is naturally curious, detail oriented, possesses a business-focused perspective, and enjoys working with a variety of stakeholders to dig into and solve data issues. Primary responsibilities include monitoring and executing processes for new data requests, changes, and deletions, ensuring accurate data entry and maintenance in relevant systems; performing internet research to validate addresses and utilizing Microsoft Excel for data analysis and reporting; utilizing data quality tools and techniques to ensure data accuracy; enhancing data management and improving data quality outcomes by documenting, profiling, and analyzing organization-wide data; maximizing the value of data assets by contributing to the development of data quality rules, metrics, and thresholds; supporting resolution of data anomalies through profiling, validation checks, and root cause analysis; gaining stakeholder buy-in for process improvements; identifying missing or incorrect data and initiating corrective actions; contributing to continuous improvement of data management processes; serving as an ambassador for Enterprise Data; cultivating trust and building expertise in company data and systems; acting as a peer-to-peer coach; actively partnering with cross-functional stakeholders; and taking ownership of operational tasks and team support. Knowledge, skills, and abilities required include strong technical, analytical, problem-solving and storytelling skills; attention to detail; ability to collaborate and influence; ability to document and communicate data management issues; positive and self-motivated attitude; knowledge of MDM principles (preferred); proficiency with SQL and data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau; proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (preferred); experience with R or Python (preferred); exposure to Business Transactional Systems such as Oracle EBS, Siebel CRM, Salesforce (preferred); working knowledge of ticketing systems like ServiceNow; previous experience in data quality leveraging third-party reference data; understanding of Go-to-Market customer installs base/asset management processes; and a bachelor's degree in relevant fields (preferred) with minimum 2 years of experience in Data Management and Governance. The role is located in the United States due to the nature of the data. Physical demands include typical office environment work. The annual base pay ranges from $55,506.00 to $83,260.00 with potential additional compensation and benefits. F5 is an equal opportunity employer.

Now, we’re helping our customers improve the performance and security of their applications, whether in the cloud or at the edge. F5 is the only company on the planet that powers applications from development through their entire lifecycle, enabling our customers—enterprise businesses, service providers, governments, and consumer brands—to deliver differentiated, high-performing, and secure digital experiences to their customers. Accurate and reliable data is a critical enabler in achieving this goal. We are seeking an experienced Data Steward II to join our Enterprise Data Management team, working closely with business partners across the company globally. You will support data quality initiatives, with a primary focus on quality analysis, managing customer hierarchies, and executing data change requests and performing necessary data entry in our core domains. Secondary responsibilities include proactively contributing enterprise data quality reporting, monitoring, and project efforts. This role directly supports globally distributed, cross-functional business stakeholders in Core Data and Data Quality management activities. Our Data Quality team also collaborates closely with the broader EDM team to support Data Governance and Metadata efforts. This role will also collaborate closely with other Enterprise Data Management resources to socialize and drive adoption of these efforts. The ideal candidate for this role is naturally curious, detail oriented, possesses a business-focused perspective, and enjoys working with a variety of stakeholders to dig into and solve data issues. Primary responsibilities include monitoring and executing processes for new data requests, changes, and deletions, ensuring accurate data entry and maintenance in relevant systems; performing internet research to validate addresses and utilizing Microsoft Excel for data analysis and reporting; utilizing data quality tools and techniques to ensure data accuracy; enhancing data management and improving data quality outcomes by documenting, profiling, and analyzing organization-wide data; maximizing the value of data assets by contributing to the development of data quality rules, metrics, and thresholds; supporting resolution of data anomalies through profiling, validation checks, and root cause analysis; gaining stakeholder buy-in for process improvements; identifying missing or incorrect data and initiating corrective actions; contributing to continuous improvement of data management processes; serving as an ambassador for Enterprise Data; cultivating trust and building expertise in company data and systems; acting as a peer-to-peer coach; actively partnering with cross-functional stakeholders; and taking ownership of operational tasks and team support. Knowledge, skills, and abilities required include strong technical, analytical, problem-solving and storytelling skills; attention to detail; ability to collaborate and influence; ability to document and communicate data management issues; positive and self-motivated attitude; knowledge of MDM principles (preferred); proficiency with SQL and data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau; proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (preferred); experience with R or Python (preferred); exposure to Business Transactional Systems such as Oracle EBS, Siebel CRM, Salesforce (preferred); working knowledge of ticketing systems like ServiceNow; previous experience in data quality leveraging third-party reference data; understanding of Go-to-Market customer installs base/asset management processes; and a bachelor's degree in relevant fields (preferred) with minimum 2 years of experience in Data Management and Governance. The role is located in the United States due to the nature of the data. Physical demands include typical office environment work. The annual base pay ranges from $55,506.00 to $83,260.00 with potential additional compensation and benefits. F5 is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Capabilities & Insights Analyst
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

You will support consultants and clients developing capabilities to gain insights to solve specific client business problems, and will leverage your experience in market and economic research to be a thought-partner to teams and clients.

In this role, you will prioritize research activities to have the most impact. You will develop industry knowledge and expertise, both general and in specific sub-sectors. Day-to-day tasks may include a variety of analyses, such as benchmarking, trend identification, industry profiling, market sizing, growth projections. Typical end products are PowerPoint documents, written memos, models in Excel, and frameworks.

You’ll also collaborate with our global research team to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. You will be able to develop knowledge and help support the continuous improvement of our knowledge assets, innovating firm knowledge and delivery through special projects, both with client teams and on a stand-alone basis.

You will work in Bucharest office as a part of local Regional Research Team. From time to time, you may be staffed directly on client engagements, which means working closely with our clients and, in some cases, traveling to their sites. Staffing could include engaging in EU-wide opportunities to capture and amplify impact across the region. This will allow you to contribute to projects with a broader scope and influence, enhancing your ability to drive meaningful outcomes at scale.

You’ll be a part of our global Client Capabilities Network, which includes more than 8,000 knowledge professionals who work alongside our consultants and clients to generate distinctive insights and proprietary knowledge.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Master's degree in economics, banking, business, econometrics, or a related field
Proven academic achievement with demonstrated extracurricular activities
Professional experience in analytical or research roles
Solid understanding of economic, financial, and general business concepts and terminology
CFA would be an asset
Exemplify analytical and problem-solving skills
Any international experience would be a strong asset (including Erasmus exchange, internship, volunteering)
Professional attitude and service orientation, team player
Strong multi-tasking abilities, flexibility, and patience in a fluid environment
Proficient with Excel
Effective communication skills, fluent English and Romanian
Show more

Title: Automation & Data Analyst-1 year fixed-term contract
HTML:
Role Overview

We are looking for a curious and solution-oriented specialist to lead and implement automation initiatives that streamline operational processes. You will primarily work with Power Automate, Power Apps, and SQL, but also have the freedom to experiment with modern tools such as Python, Power BI, or others available in the company.

This role is ideal for someone with a strong process mindset, a passion for technology-driven efficiency, and the confidence to think outside the box when it comes to innovation and problem-solving.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain automated workflows using Power Automate and Power Apps to reduce manual workload and optimize internal processes;
  • Create low-code/ no-code solutions that meet operational needs and are easy to maintain by business users;
  • Analyze data flow between systems and identify opportunities for streamlining or automation;
  • Use SQL to extract, manipulate, and validate data for process automation and reporting purposes;
  • Propose, test, and implement innovative ideas using other available technologies such as Python, Excel (Power Query), or Power BI;
  • Collaborate with operations, IT, and cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities and prioritize them based on impact;
  • Document workflows, business rules, and data logic in a clear and structured way;
  • Actively contribute to a continuous improvement culture by promoting automation and experimentation.


Technical Requirements:

  • University degree or final-year student in a technical field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar);
  • Strong analytical and mathematical thinking – ability to understand and model logical processes;
  • Genuine curiosity and willingness to learn new tools and technologies quickly;
  • Hands-on experience with Microsoft Power Automate and Power Apps is a strong plus, but not mandatory if you’re a fast learner;
  • Basic understanding of SQL or interest in learning it rapidly;
  • Interest in or basic exposure to Python or other scripting tools is an advantage;
  • Comfortable with Microsoft Excel (including formulas, Power Query is a plus);
  • Analytical thinking and a structured approach to problem-solving;
  • Creativity and an open mindset – not afraid to experiment with new ideas or tools;
  • Self-driven, proactive, and comfortable working independently;
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Passion for technology, digital transformation, and process improvement.


Soft Skills:

  • Strong collaboration skills – comfortable working with diverse teams across functions and from different countries;
  • Clear and concise communication – both written and verbal;
  • Open mindset and receptiveness to feedback and new ideas;
  • Creative problem solving and the ability to think outside the box;
  • Self-driven and proactive approach to tasks and learning.


At Metropolitan Life, part of MetLife, Inc, one of the largest life insurance companies in the world, we’re leading the global transformation of an industry we’ve long defined. Named a Certified Great Place to Work, we are united in purpose, diverse in perspective, and dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our customers.


Great Place To Work® Certified in Romania


Metropolitan Life is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Metropolitan’s Life policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Product Data Analyst - Romania, Europe (Remote)
Description:
Location: Remote, Europe (Bulgaria, Sofia preferred, hybrid possible in our office locations) | Full-time | €44K - 53K

About WebPros

WebPros is committed to empowering businesses worldwide through cutting-edge solutions in web hosting, billing automation, infrastructure, server management, and online marketing. Since our founding in 2017, we’ve rapidly grown into a global leader, expanding our robust portfolio to include industry-defining brands such as cPanel & WHM, Plesk, WHMCS, SolusVM, NIXStats, XOVI, SocialBee, and Sitejet.

Today, we power 85 million+ websites across 900,000+ servers worldwide, backed by a 600+ strong team of dedicated professionals spanning multiple continents. At WebPros, we embrace a fully remote, borderless workplace with a focus on flexibility, autonomy, and work-life balance. Whether you prefer working from a bustling city hub or a quiet home office, we enable our teams to thrive from anywhere while staying deeply connected through our strong collaborative culture.

Your Role

Hi, I’m Bartek, Director SEO & Social Media Marketing Product Portfolio here at WebPros and your future manager. I started my journey by founding a digital agency in my early twenties, which led me into the world of product strategy, growth, and analytics. Over the past 15 years, I’ve helped scale SaaS products to hundreds of thousands of users, led teams across product, development, and marketing, and contributed to building a structured, data-informed culture across WebPros. Today, I focus on driving product success through measurable insights, strong execution, and scalable frameworks—and I’m looking for someone who’s excited to do the same.

We’re now hiring a Product Analyst to help us level up our product analytics and tracking across our global portfolio. This role is all about connecting the dots—from user behavior to product impact—and enabling our teams to make better decisions, faster. You’ll work across four product streams (both SaaS and on-premise), supporting ~20 product managers and collaborating with engineering and data teams. You’ll play a key role in defining meaningful product metrics, helping PMs ask the right questions, and guiding engineers on how to implement clean, actionable tracking.

The biggest challenge in this role? Building a full, end-to-end picture of user activity tracking. That means navigating legal/privacy boundaries, working closely with engineering to ensure quality data flows into Mixpanel and our data warehouse (BigQuery, Redshift, PostgreSQL), and educating PMs on how to choose the right metrics and interpret results. It’s a hands-on role, and we’ll look to you as the go-to expert for product analytics tools like Mixpanel, SQL, and Looker Studio.

You’ll thrive here if you’re comfortable educating others, writing your own queries, structuring metrics from scratch, and collaborating across functions to turn ambiguity into clarity. If you’re the kind of person who gets excited about fixing messy data, documenting tracking plans, and influencing product direction through insight—you’ll fit right in.

You might struggle here if you’re looking for a narrowly scoped analyst role with mature processes already in place. We’re still building the playbook—and you’ll be helping to shape it.

As part of a small and growing product analytics team, you’ll work across ~20 product managers and 4 product streams. While the data engineering team handles broader data ingestion, you’ll sit at the intersection of product and insight—bringing user behavior to the surface so our teams can act on it. And as part of WebPros’ broader product organization, you’ll contribute to shaping how analytics scales across our brands.

This is a hands-on, high-impact role where your ability to translate data into action will directly influence our product direction and customer experience.

Below, you’ll find everything you need to decide if this role is right for you. From our culture and work style to the specifics of the position and hiring process. We believe in transparency, so we’ve put in the effort to give you a real, inside look at what it’s like to work here.

Your Impact In The First 180 Days

We don’t believe in endless checklists of requirements. Instead, here’s what success looks like in your first 6 months:


30 Days: Familiarize yourself with our full product portfolio, from SaaS to on-premise tools. Understand the structure of our four product streams and begin building relationships with product managers, engineers, and data stakeholders. Review and update tracking requirements documentation and assume ownership of Mixpanel communication and implementation support.
60 Days: Take ownership of core product metrics for your assigned product stream(s). Establish tracking processes with product and engineering teams, guide event implementation, and support engineers in implementing tracking specs correctly. Deliver your first post-launch analysis and help PMs identify actionable product insights.
120 Days: Lead in closing key gaps by coaching engineers on clean data implementation and supporting PMs in identifying meaningful metrics and creating data stories. Run end-to-end behavioral analysis for features across multiple product lines. Begin building strategic partnerships with the Data Engineering team to enhance user activity data with broader data lake metrics.
180 Days: Establish yourself as a trusted advisor across multiple product streams. Drive improvements in analytics processes and data documentation, and proactively contribute to team-wide best practices. Influence roadmap decisions, help shape how success is measured across product lines, and start educating PMs and engineers to improve analytics maturity across the product org.


As you grow in this role, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your impact across all four product streams—mentoring others, contributing to analytics tooling decisions, and driving standardization across our tracking and reporting ecosystem.

You’ll Thrive Here If You


You enjoy helping others level up — from defining tracking strategies to coaching others on interpreting data.
Are confident working across multiple product streams, collaborating with 20+ PMs and diverse engineering teams.
Have strong hands-on experience with Mixpanel, including maintaining lexicons, validating implementation, and driving tracking consistency.
Can work end-to-end—from metric definition and SQL-based analysis to visualization in Looker Studio and strategic recommendation.
Are comfortable coaching teams on both the technical (data hygiene) and strategic (product metrics) aspects of analytics.
Communicate clearly in writing and asynchronously across stakeholders in product, engineering, and data.
Thrive in complex environments and enjoy creating clarity out of ambiguity.


You Might Struggle Here If You


Prefer to work on a single product or within a narrowly defined scope.
Need top-down instruction for daily tasks or find it hard to prioritize without a detailed playbook.
Avoid working across legal, engineering, and product to solve messy data problems collaboratively.
Expect clean and centralized data to always be available—some digging and reconciliation is required.
Aren’t comfortable with technical tools like SQL, Redshift, BigQuery, or Mixpanel, or need significant support to operate independently.
Struggle to educate and coach others on the “why” and “how” of good analytics practices.


How We Work


Team & Collaboration: Remote-first and async-friendly setup, embedded within the product org and working closely with Product Managers, Engineers, and the Data team across four product streams.
Team Structure: You’ll be 1 of 3 Product Analysts supporting ~20 Product Managers, working cross-functionally across four product streams with dedicated product and engineering teams.
Communication & Meetings: Clear, structured documentation using Confluence and O365; async-first communication via Slack; minimal, focused meetings held via Teams.
Tooling & Stack: Daily use of SQL, Python, Mixpanel, Google ETL, BigQuery, Redshift, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Looker Studio, and Google Sheets.
Collaboration & Documentation: Jira for planning and tracking; Confluence and Looker dashboards for transparent documentation and sharing of analytical outputs.
Ownership & Autonomy: Analysts own the full workflow — from defining metrics and data requirements to conducting analysis and presenting actionable insights.
Rituals & Process: Weekly team syncs and regular squad rituals ensure alignment, adaptability, and a continuous feedback loop between data and product direction.


Our Culture

WebPros is built on diversity, not just in principle but by design. We’ve grown through acquiring industry-leading brands, bringing together teams from 42+ nationalities, 20+ countries, and 10+ brands. Instead of enforcing a one-size-fits-all culture, we embrace unique perspectives, different working styles, and localized expertise to drive global innovation.

We are a fully remote, async-friendly company where transparency, open communication, and collaborative problem-solving define how we work. Whether you thrive in the fast pace of a startup or the stability of an established product, WebPros offers a dynamic, evolving career journey that you can shape based on your strengths.

We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable workplace where every team member feels valued, heard, and supported because our diversity is our strength.

Compensation & Benefits

We believe benefits go beyond just perks. At WebPros, we invest in your growth, flexibility, and well-being, so you can do your best work and build a meaningful career. While we strive to provide equal global benefits for all team members, some may vary by location, and we’ll clarify the details with you during the interview process.


Competitive Salary: €44K - 53K
Remote-first flexibility: Work from anywhere in Europe (or hybrid in available offices).
Health Insurance: public or private coverage, depending on your location.
Paid Time Off: Number of days depending on your location.
Development Budget: Annual personal growth allowance.
Learning Support: Udemy subscription & peer learning.
Public Transport & Meal Vouchers: Location-dependent benefits.
Team Culture: Regular team and on-site company events.


Your Hiring Experience

Hi, I’m Florian, your Talent Partner for EMEA at WebPros. I’ll guide you through the interview process, ensuring a clear, transparent, and meaningful experience. Before moving into talent and culture, I was a software engineer, so I understand what it’s like to navigate technical hiring. My goal is to make this process a genuine, two-way conversation where you feel informed, valued, and empowered to make the best decision for your career.

Hiring is about relationships, not just resumes. You can expect honest, constructive feedback at every step, and I welcome yours as well. No matter the outcome, I want this to be a positive and insightful experience. If you’d like to connect, feel free to reach out on LinkedIn.

Interview Process


Screening Interview (30-45 min): An informal conversation with Florian (Talent Partner) to get to know each other. We’ll explore your background, motivation, and aspirations while giving you a clear overview of WebPros, the team setup, and what to expect from the process. This is your opportunity to ask questions and make sure the role aligns with your career goals.
Hiring Manager Interview (45-60 min): A focused conversation with Bartek (Hiring Manager) to dive deeper into how you approach product analytics, collaboration, ownership, and navigating ambiguity. We’ll also align on your past experience, expectations, and ways of working to assess fit with the team and product area.
Technical & Product Case Interview (60 min): A working session with Bartek and two team members from Product and Data. Together, you’ll walk through a product analytics case, working with a real or hypothetical scenario. This step is designed to evaluate how you break down product questions, work with data, identify insights, and communicate recommendations. We’ll also look at your collaboration style, product intuition, and ability to adapt to imperfect or evolving data environments.
Offer Talk (30 min): A final conversation with Bartek and Florian to walk through the offer, discuss any remaining questions, and ensure mutual clarity on expectations and next steps.


Our Commitment to a Diverse & Inclusive Culture

At WebPros, we want every team member to feel excited to bring their full, authentic self to work. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences driving innovation and making us stronger together.

We are committed to ensuring equitable opportunities, pay, and support for all employees, regardless of identity, background, or circumstances. We foster a culture of belonging, respect, and psychological safety, where everyone feels valued, heard, and empowered to contribute meaningfully and grow.

Discrimination of any kind, including sexism, racism, xenophobia, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, and ageism, has no place here. By embracing differences and championing inclusivity, we create an environment where everyone can thrive.

We are looking forward to your application!

Best,

Bartek & Florian
Show more
